args: I guess this is the álfr tree.
I see why the sylvans say it's so special...
But no tree is worth our lives.
I still feel bad for the sylvans, though...
Right then. Soonest begun, soonest done.
Luca? What are you doing here?!
Well, I've been spendin' time tryin'\nto see this from your perspective.
And after I thought about it, I figured\nyou might come out here like this.
Does that mean you understand how\nimportant the new village is to us?
And how this tree threatens it all?
Yeah, I get it. But that still don't mean\nyou can just chop it down.
Then you're just prioritizing\nsylvans over the rest of us!
Listen, the village I'm trying to create\nain't like other villages. You know that.
It's a place where everyone will belong,\nand no one will be rejected.
Which means there's no point if we're\nalready dividing into camps of sylvans\nversus everybody else.
So what, then? Would you have us starve\nand die to prove your own ideals?
No! All I'm askin' for is a little time to\ncome up with a solution that works\nfor all of us.
And when can we expect this flash of\ninspiration? Tomorrow? The day after?\nPerhaps after winter has already arrived?!
If you dither and dicker, we're like to\nfind the ground frozen solid before\nwe can plant a single seed!
If there was an easy solution to dealing\nwith this huge tree, you'd have already\nfound it.
Look, I just need you to trust me.\nWill you please do that?
What I UNDERSTAND is that even if we \nwork together, we're no match for you.
Huh? What are you talking about?\nYou make it sound like I'm going to\nphysically force you to do things.
Perhaps not for day-to-day tasks,\nbut I've no doubt you'd use force\nto protect your precious tree.
At the end of the day, you're sylvan,\nand we are not. A shame, but truth.
I should have known it was impossible\nto make a village like this a reality.
It's not like that. I'm not...
Eavesdroppin' on me again, eh, Sis?
Sorta, yeah. Seems like non-sylvan folks\njust don't get what that tree means to us.
Yeah, but I understand. I mean, I'd be\nhard-pressed to give up my home for a\nmagical rokkan dirt clod or whatever.
...Heh. It's funny. The old you would have\njust ran in here and cut the tree down,\nto hell with the consequences.
And the new me would still do it if I\nthought that would solve the problem.
But if we cut the álfr tree down,\nthe sylvans will abandon the village.
I gotta find a solution what makes\nEVERYONE happy here.
Aw! My brother's all grown up.
Where's all this coming from?\nI mean, it ain't like I was gonna be\nyoung and reckless my whole life.
There are too many people\ncounting on me.
It's just not like you, is all.\n...But it IS amazing.

Seriously! You wouldn't normally give two
figs about what everyone else thinks.
You'd just make some weird suggestion
and then go about your merry way.
Like, ＂Let's just pick up the forest \nand drop it somewhere else!＂\nor whatever.
Actually, I did think about that.
Not the whole forest, but I've been\nwonderin' if there's a way to maybe\ntransplant the álfr tree somewhere.
But we'd need a ton of time and people\nto move such a massive tree, so it's\nprobably a non-starter.
I bet you could manage something if\n{player_name} helped out!
No way. It would take every single\nperson at the Halidom to even...
Wait. EVERYONE at the Halidom means...
Over here, you guys! This way!
Grandma's good pajamas!\nWhat's with the tree?!
I asked all the dragons to\nhelp me carry it over here!
Now the tree survives AND the village\ncan continue. It's a perfect solution!
You're really somethin' else, Luca.\nTo think, you'd bring DRAGONS to help.
I told you I was gonna find a plan\nthat worked for absolutely everyone!
Er, but dragons are like deities to us.\nMaking them carry your stuff like\ncommon pack mules seems so...
Dragons may be like gods to humans,\nbut they're carrying the álfr tree—\nwhich is like a sylvan god.
And THAT'S what I call\nharmony between races!
